thread.title: Georgia accepts bid to the NIT - 247Sports
thread.title_full: Georgia accepts bid to the NIT - 247Sports

title: Georgia accepts bid to the NIT - 247Sports
text:
Manage Georgia accepts bid to the NIT Georgia's NCAA Tournament hopes didn't materialize but the Bulldogs do get to keep playing after making the NIT. Slot to Georgia Links 
NCAA Tournament hopes didn’t materialize for Georgia after its 19-14 campaign but the Bulldogs will get to play in College Basketball’s version of a consolation prize, the National Invitation Tournament (NIT). 
The Bulldogs have been selected by the NIT as a No. 2 seed and will take on Belmont on Wednesday at 7 p.m. ET. It marks a rematch from the first round of last year's NIT when the Bulldogs, as a No. 3 seed took on the Bruins, who were a No. 6 seed. (Photo: UGA Athletics: John Kelley) Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
Coming into Selection Sunday the Bulldogs had extremely slim hopes of being selected to the NCAA Tournament but those fell by the wayside earlier in the day. Against the field of 68 the Bulldogs went 1-10 with a win versus Vanderbilt and losses to Kentucky (3), Florida (2), South Carolina (2), Arkansas (1), Kansas (1), and Marquette (1). 
This marks the third time in the past four years the Bulldogs have made the NIT. The only time they didn’t was the 2014-2015 season when they made the NCAA Tournament. 
If the Bulldogs win their first-round match up with Belmont they will take on the winner of Indiana (18-15) and Georgia Tech (17-15) in round two. Author
